title: 1900s, Metal type, gothic condensed, engraved
content:
Want ot identify the two typefaces; (A) Williams' Soap and (B) Barbers Favorite.

(B) Similar to Gothic Condensed No. 521, but I don't think it's the one.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/williamssoap2_150_3558.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [williamssoap2\_150.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/typophile.com/files/williamssoap2_150.jpg) | 113.83 KB |
author: widdlywee

comments.content:
Lithographed label, not typefaces.  
WILLIAM'S SOAP is in a lettering style called "concave." Here are a couple of digital fonts in the concave style -- not including concave Tuscan, which has spiked outlines:  
Concave Extended  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/concave-extended/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/concave-extended/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/concave-extended/")  
Fredericksburg NF  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/fredericksburg-wbw/")  
Don

The style is also sometimes called arched Gothic. Here is a condensed version:  
Arched Gothic Condensed :  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/arched-gothic-condensed-sg/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/arched-gothic-condensed-sg/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/arched-gothic-condensed-sg/")  
Don

You're welcome William.  
If you can edit fonts you can make this by clipping spurs and rounding outlines on P & S etc. of several Concave Tuscans or Gothic Tuscans. Not a 5 minute job.  
Don

WILLIAMS' SOAP: don't have the answer but here some alternatives you may like to consider: [Centennial Banker LHF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/centennialbanker.php), [Number 154](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/woodentypefonts/number-154) and **[Engel BA](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/intellecta/engel)**  
BARBERS FAVOURITE: still searching for good alternative... Stay tuned!

Could be edited. Radiant Antique:  
 [http://www.fontspace.com/douglas-day/radiantantique](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.fontspace.com/douglas-day/radiantantique "http://www.fontspace.com/douglas-day/radiantantique")  
Get rid of the ornamentation and it's as close as anything mentioned so far.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RadianPlain_6210.jpg)
  
Don

BARBERS FAVOURITE: as previously said, some I like as alternatives: [Hamilton](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/hamilton), [Equal Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.aringtypeface.com/equal-sans), [Eldon WF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productid=16), [Type No5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150130154353/http:/www.waldenfont.com/product.asp?productID=4)

You're welcome William. Have a smooth shave.  
Don
